brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the efficacy of mid-stromal implantation of an isolated Bowman layer graft, to
      reduce and stabilize ectasia in eyes with advanced keratoconus

clinical_study.brief_title: Isolated Bowman Layer Graft for Reducing and Stabilizing Advanced Keratoconus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        •Advanced keratoconus

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Further ophthalmic diseases

          -  History of ocular surgery

          -  Pregnancy, brest feeding

intervention.description: For patients with progressive advanced keratoconus, a mid-stromal manual dissection is made and a donor isolated Bowman layer is positioned into the stromal pocket.

facility.name: Netherlands Institute for Innovative Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Mid-stromal Isolated Bowman Layer Graft Implantation to Reduce and Stabilize Advanced Keratoconus

overall_official.affiliation: Netherlands Institute for Innovative Ocular Surgery

primary_outcome.description: Reduction and stabilizing of the corneal power after Bowman layer graft implantation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: Netherlands Institute for Innovative Ocular Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Netherlands Institute for Innovative Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
